content:
The "Opponent and/or Mystery" step refers to the main obstacle or conflict that the main characters must overcome in order to achieve their goal. In this story, the main opponent is the zombies apocalypse that has forced the characters to confront the loss of their daughter and their strained marriage.

The Zombies are the physical embodiment of the apocalypse that has taken over the world and the main characters must constantly face the threat of the zombies as they try to survive and keep the bed and breakfast running. The Zombies could also be seen as a metaphor for the emotional turmoil that the main characters are going through, representing the forces that are trying to tear them apart.

Another potential opponent in the story could be the main characters' own grief and denial. They try to hold on to the past and maintain a sense of normalcy while they are struggling to cope with their daughter's death and the apocalypse. This internal conflict could serve as an obstacle for the main characters as they try to come to terms with their loss and move on with their lives.

Another potential opponent could be the other survivors who come to seek shelter at the bed and breakfast. They may have different ideas about how to survive and cope with the apocalypse, which could create conflicts and tensions between the main characters and their allies.

The mystery could be the reason why the zombies are attacking, how to stop them, and how to survive the apocalypse.
